intro: Restio compressus, commonly known as the narrow restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant features narrow, cylindrical leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, often in open, sunny habitats. Restio compressus is adapted to withstand coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds.
